thread.title: Disney Frozen Sing Along Elsa doll hits retail stores in Australia | The
thread.title_full: Disney Frozen Sing Along Elsa doll hits retail stores in Australia | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: Disney Frozen Sing Along Elsa doll hits retail stores in Australia | The
text:
The Sing Along Elsa doll has been on sale in Target for a week but more stock is already being shipped to Australia.
Hunter Products sales manager James Hunter, who is distributing the doll, said Frozen is a phenomenon that appeals to 10 month old babies and adult women though the core market is girls aged three to eight.
Sing Along Elsa
“It’s a juggernaut, the like of which we haven’t seen in toys for at least 10 years,” Mr Hunter said.
“Steady shipments are coming in from now until Christmas and we expect it to be one of the top toys for Christmas.”
Let’s sing it again! Picture by Chris Pavlich
This is the second Frozen doll to be released. The first, released last year, was Snowflake Elsa but the new doll’s novelty is that she sings the whole song Let It Go and also has a karaoke feature that enables children to sing along.
It has been awarded the Australian Girls Toy of the Year for 2015 but she is not cheap, presently selling at Target for $79.
Mr Hunter said the technology is different to anything seen previously. The technology also explains the delay in her arrival and relatively small number of dolls arriving in the first shipment.
“There are 30,000 here now but more will be coming every week now,” he said.
“We sold 55,000 of the first doll last year so we understand the demand. We anticipate selling 2 million dolls worldwide.”
Elly Oh sings Let It Go 0:30 Play video Elly Oh belted out Demi Lovato's Disney tune from Frozen. Courtesy: The Voice.
news.com.au 16 Jun 2014 Entertainment The doll is on the shelf in Target and will be on sale in Kmart, Toys ‘R Us and Myer by mid-August.
catherine.lambert@news.com.au
Originally published as Elsa doll frenzy shows we just can’t ‘Let it Go’
